fields.description:
I'm seeing this fairly often in the latest QA runs in multiple sequences. From a test perspective the instance(s) are going from pending to terminated after a handful of polls. 
Thanks,
-Matt


Example run(s):
http://qa-server/euca-qa/display_test.php?testname=GA-vmware-windows-multiversion-esxi-41-3.2&uid=1007

http://qa-server/euca-qa/display_test.php?testname=GA-vmware-windows-multinet-esxi-50-3.2&uid=1008

fields.summary: Walrus timestamp parsing for internal requests incorrect 1200-1300GMT

comments.body:
Moving to blocker as this does not look like it's isolated to imager, vmware, etc..  Dmitrii noticed it occurs during a specific window of time (actually timestamp around ~4am) in all failed tests. I was able to force the timestamp to 4am and reproduce on a non-vmware setup. Zach looking into it now...
Thanks,
-Matt

Fixed by changing the date format string from the hour specifier 'hh' to 'HH' to indicate 24hr clock rather than 12hr. Removes the affect of the apache-commons httpclient.util.DateUtil.parseDate() bug where it parses 24hr values as 12hr values all correctly except 12-1pm GMT.

Committed to maint/3.2/security

Confirmed fix in today's build. I repeated the tests which originally were found to reproduce the issue; stopped cloud, disabled ntp, changed dates on all components, restarted cloud, confirmed operations which previously failed such as run-instances
